candidates.title: Ted Nugent Death Hoax
candidates.content:
Claim:
Ted Nugent was killed in a Montana hunting accident.
On 28 April 2017, a number of unreliable web sites began publishing stories reporting that rock musician and conservative icon Ted Nugent had been killed in a hunting accident in Montana:
Ted Nugent, 70s rocker turned hunting guide and conservative icon, was shot and killed early this morning in a tragic hunting accident. While setting up his tree stand just outside a wildlife reserve in Montana, Nugent was fired on and hit in the chest by a hunter with a scope nearly a quarter of a mile away who believed he was a brown bear.
There are no legitimate news reports of any ill fate befalling Nugent  in fact, he made a Facebook Live video with his wife Shermane on the same afternoon the death hoax starting circulating, in which they confirmed he is indeed alive and well:
She posted another live video a few minutes later in which her husband's voice could be heard while she played with the couple's dogs:
Nugent's spokeswoman Linda Peterson also confirmed in an e-mail that reports of Nugent's untimely death were "fake news."
Nugent is famous for his rock career, but has also become an outspoken supporter of conservative political figures, such as former Alaska Governor Sarah Palin and President Donald Trump. He most recently made news when he was pictured alongside Palin and fellow rock singer Kid Rock at the White House, where they all dined with President Trump. Nugent is also a divisive figure due to comments he has made about former President Barack Obama and Secretary of State Hillary Clinton that have been characterized as racist, sexist and potentially inciting violence.
candidates.description: Despite rumors that the rocker was killed in a hunting accident in Montana, he remains alive and well.

result.explanation: The provided text from Snopes.com explicitly debunks the claim in the news caption.  The caption states that Ted Nugent was killed in a hunting accident, while the Snopes article labels this a death hoax and provides evidence that Nugent is still alive.  The Snopes article is a reputable fact-checking source, making its conclusion highly reliable.

final_result.explanation: The caption claims that Ted Nugent, a 70s rocker, hunting guide, and conservative icon, was shot and killed in a hunting accident. This claim is directly contradicted by both internal and external evidence.  Internally, the provided image shows Ted Nugent alive and playing a guitar, which is inconsistent with the caption's assertion of his death. The internal check highlights a significant discrepancy with high confidence (confidence_score: 10).  Externally, fact-checking from Snopes.com definitively debunks the death claim, stating that Nugent is alive and well, and citing evidence such as a Facebook Live video made by Nugent and his wife shortly after the hoax started circulating. The external check also achieves a high confidence score (confidence_score: 10).  Both the internal image analysis and the external fact-check from a reputable source strongly support the conclusion that the caption is false. There is no conflict between the internal and external checks; both independently and unequivocally confirm that the caption is out of context.  The high confidence scores from both checks (10/10) further solidify this conclusion. Therefore, the caption is definitively out of context, with a confidence score of 10.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal (image analysis) and external (Snopes fact-check) validation strongly and independently confirm that the caption is false.  The image shows Nugent alive, and Snopes debunks the death hoax.  There is complete agreement between the two checks, resulting in a high confidence score.
